Posts.Content: Originally Posted by HighlanderCFH Welcome aboard, Pom. I'm not well versed in post HIFU treatments. But keep checking back over the next day or two because others here will probably have some good ideas on your situation and what your next step might be. How long will it be before you are able to consult with your doctor? This is probably something you need to do as soon as possible. Good luck to you! Chuck Thank you Chuck appreciate that and I am hoping to be speaking or hearing from Dr Sconti in the next day or two.sorry I forgot to mention that I am 70 years old and apart from this reasonably fit. I posted my story on the forum in 2012 so if anybody wants to look at my history it's all there under my name POMCHUERON Ron
Posts.Title: Worried about reaccurance nearly 5 years post HIFU

Posts.Content: PSA level rising from zero post up over a period of 4 1/2 years and now latest reading taken few days ago and is .94. I am suspecting that I have a recurrence as my PSA has gone up from .65. Six months ago and that is a large percentage percentage increase over a short period of time. Would appreciate Advice as I cannot contact my doctor at this time. I am age 70 reasonably fit with no symptoms and good continence.
